body:
Is your application processing events when you paste into another application? Clipboard contents is transferred peer-to-peer on X11.

On termination, if GLFW owns the clipboard contents, it transfers it to your clipboard manager. That is why it works after your application exits.
Do you have a complete, short example that triggers the bug?

I took a simple example of GLFW and called glfwSetClipboardString(window, "string to be copied") there and that bug behavior kept

just run clipboard_bug binary file, focus any text editor and press Ctrl+V (nothing will happens), then close simple example and press Ctrl+V in text editor, "string to be copied" will be pasted

you can use build.sh file in archive to build application quickly, just change my paths to yours

[clipboard.zip](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/files/823019/clipboard.zip)

I can reproduce this with glfw's `clipboard` test program.

1. Ctrl+C in the `clipboard` window. The test reports that it has set my clipboard to "Hello GLFW World!".

2. Ctrl+V in the clipboard window reports that the clipboard contents are "Hello GLFW World!", as expected.

3. Ctrl+V in my text editor (Geany) has no visible effect (the text is not pasted, and no error is reported). After this, however, that instance of Geany will not accept pasted text from any source, even after the clipboard test is terminated.

4. Ctrl+V in Firefox causes it to freeze for several seconds, but it does seem to recover (the text is not pasted).

Debian 8.7, XFCE 4.10
GLFW current master (3.3.0)

Edit: As @weenup reports, after closing the clipboard test I can then paste the string successfully. The problems only occur while the window is still open.

Edit 2: Extra info. Copying and pasting from one instance of the `clipboard` test into another instance of the same test causes the second window to lock up.
Bisected to either 706868dad83b421703e50cf0c45a5abb672e6d2e (does not build for me) or ccfd6dde459f5cb2ea6c28b84c6e3e1e82a60d42.

Poking a bit more. It seems that the `handleSelectionRequest` function in `x11_window.c` is not being called when I try to paste into another window, although it is called twice when I close the glfw window. Not sure if I've misunderstood the code (I have no experience with X11 clipboard code), but this seems significant. Is it possible that SelectionRequest events are being filtered out somewhere, and are simply not being responded to?

Edit: Yes, it looks as though SelectionRequest events are being discarded here: https://github.com/glfw/glfw/blob/master/src/x11_window.c#L960 apparently (according to the comment) because they relate to a window that has previously been destroyed. This test seems incorrect, probably due to the "helper window" changes in https://github.com/glfw/glfw/commit/ccfd6dde459f5cb2ea6c28b84c6e3e1e82a60d42.

issue.title: Handle X11 Selection* events despite NULL window

issue.body:
`processEvent` in `x11_window.c` currently discards events that can not be mapped to a current GLFW window. However, this breaks clipboard functionality by failing to respond to SelectionRequest and SelectionClear events.

This commit moves processing of these important clipboard events to before the NULL window test so that they are always considered.

Fixes #961 (tentatively; there is probably an underlying structural change to be made that fixes this properly).
